column4: Sounds like a problem I had some time ago, it started randomly... try taking the ethernet cable out, restart Ubuntu, THEN put the ethernet cable back in; allow it to connect and test again. If that doesn't work, hard reset the router whilst doing the same thing, during the time you have the computer rebooting.
Why did it just show up in the new release? I was thinking this was the time to switch.
I have no idea. I don't think it is an 8.10 issue - I had it in 8.04.
I haven't seen it before when I installed Wubi , or the real deal
So you are saying for me to try to disconnect the cable, put it back in? reset my modem and the router?
Just take the ethernet out before shutting down Ubuntu. Restart the computer. Once you have logged back into Ubuntu, put the ethernet cable back in. That should work for you.
So when I go to reboot to Ubuntu right now, I should have it out.  Wait till I get to the desktop, and put it back in , see if it worked?
That still didn't solve the issue.
I don't know, in that case. Did you try rebooting your router/modem?
yes, it just twinkled again and said "connecting"
Are security updates still given to the earlier release? whatever LTS
So in general, I could install 8.04 without any issues ?
Nope. By default, LTS versions only notify you of LTS releases
